FAQ

Questions we’re asked most

Do you repair single and double glazed aluminium joinery?

Yes. We work on both single- and double-glazed aluminium windows and doors, including rollers, seals, hardware and alignment.

Do you work across the whole Wellington region?

Yes. We cover Central Wellington, the Hutt Valley, Porirua, Petone and Kāpiti every week.

How fast can you quote?

Send photos or describe the issue and we usually reply the same day. Emergency call-outs are available for stuck sliders.

Can you source older aluminium parts?

We stock common profiles and work with national suppliers to match out-of-production rollers, wedges and handles.

What happens if glass breaks while you’re working on it?

Most glass we work on is older and can have hidden edge damage or movement in the frame. We take care, but sometimes a pane can crack during normal repair or adjustment. If glass breaks during normal work on existing/aged glass, replacement glass and reglazing are charged at standard rates. If we clearly damage a sound pane through a mistake on our part, we’ll discuss a fair way forward. Nothing here affects your rights under New Zealand consumer law.

Do you service Porirua and the Hutt Valley?

Yes. We’re in Porirua, Lower Hutt and Upper Hutt every week and can group nearby jobs to keep pricing sharp.

Can you fix leaks at the sill or mitred corners?

Yes. We open the joinery, back-seal the mitres, re-seal the sill and keep drainage paths clear. See our mitre & sill reseal service for details.

Ready for smooth windows & sliders?

Call us or request a fast quote. Same-day replies.
